titles.title: District of Columbia Zoning Commission Home Rule Act
District of Columbia Zoning Commission Home Rule Act
To revise the composition of the Zoning Commission for the District of Columbia so that the Commission will consist solely of members appointed by the government of the District of Columbia.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

bill.summary:
District of Columbia Zoning Commission Home Rule Act
This bill modifies the composition of the District of Columbia Zoning Commission to require the commission to consist of only three mayoral appointees. Currently, the commission consists of five individuals: three mayoral appointees, the Architect of the Capitol, and the Director of the National Park Service. The bill removes the Architect of the Capitol and the Director of the National Park Service from the commission.
